definition: to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
a unit of length/inch/thumb
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Li
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: That day and the next, Arthur refused to leave the Chimney Rock.
sentences.chinese: 之後的日子裏，亞瑟待在煙囪巖上寸步不離。

sentences.english: My shy little sister clung to me like aleechall through the party.
sentences.chinese: 我那靦腆的小妹在聚會上寸步不離地跟着我。

sentences.english: Other fans watch the games at home, glued to their TV sets.
sentences.chinese: 其它的球迷則守在家裏寸步不離地收看電視轉播。

sentences.english: May happiness follow you everywhere ...just like we do.
sentences.chinese: 願快樂隨時與您同在，就如同我們與您寸步不離一般。

sentences.english: Never let James and Sirius out of his sight.
sentences.chinese: 總是跟詹姆和小天狼星寸步不離的。

sentences.english: Most guys will follow the woman everywhere, and not leave her side for a minute.
sentences.chinese: 大多數男人會隨處跟隨女人，並且寸步不離。

sentences.english: He sticks to her like glue, ie never leaves her.
sentences.chinese: 他如膠似漆地寸步不離開她。

sentences.english: The maintenance guys really worked to keep their jets together.
sentences.chinese: 維護人員真的是與他們維護的飛機寸步不離。

sentences.english: It followed my footsteps with a pertinacity which it would be difficult to make the reader comprehend.
sentences.chinese: 它跟我寸步不離，這鼓擰勁兒讀者確實難以理解。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
needlework/sewing
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lonely soul/solitary
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
psychiatric hospital
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
examination room (in a doctor's office)
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
